conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the chance to join your community. I believe I would be a strong fit and would be happy to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). With capacity 1, applying there in round 1 is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. In contrast, School_A ranks me 1st, and School_A is my 3rd choice—still very good and much more secure. To maximize my final outcome (avoid ending up with a low-ranked option), I will apply to School_A immediately where I have top priority and a strong chance of acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission—your application is a great fit for our community. If you’d like to confirm enrollment, please reply with any next-step questions and we’ll guide you through the process.

Congratulations, and we look forward to welcoming you to School_A.
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A's true priority list. They have submitted an [APPLY] in round 1 and my quota is 1, so accepting immediately secures my top-choice match. There is no higher-ranked candidate possible for me, and delaying risks losing Student_E to a school they prefer more (School_C or School_D) if they continue applying elsewhere. Therefore, accept now.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m submitting my formal application. School_C is one of my top choices because I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to commit fully if admitted. If accepted, I will enroll and prioritize contributing positively to the school community.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B ranks me 4th, while Student_E (who ranks School_B last) is 1st in School_B’s priority and may take it if they apply there. School_C ranks me 3rd and is my 2nd choice, and I’m ahead of Student_E and Student_A there. Since Student_B has School_C as 3rd and Student_C has School_C as 2nd, competition exists, so I should apply immediately to School_C to secure a high-ranked match rather than risk losing both B and C. I’ll send a direct, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing applications in this round and considering our limited available seat, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time and care you put into your application, and we wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_B above Student_D. In this round, both Student_D and Student_B applied. With quota 1, accepting Student_D now would block a higher-priority match with Student_B, who has also expressed willingness to commit. Therefore I should reject Student_D to preserve capacity for Student_B.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me last, while several other students (especially Student_E and Student_B) are ranked above me and are also likely to apply there. Even so, applying now is still optimal because (1) it’s my #1 true preference, (2) there is no cost to applying early in this round-based setting, and (3) if I’m rejected, I can pivot quickly to School_C next round. I’ll send a strong but concise application highlighting fit and commitment.

conversation.message:

Thank you very much for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round and considering our admissions priorities and limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you a place at this time.

We sincerely appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

Rejecting Student_A preserves the seat for higher-priority applicants (E, B, C, D), especially since E ranks School_B last and B ranks us second, so C is currently the best available. Therefore, reject A now.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_C. School_B is my first choice because I value your academic rigor and the opportunities to grow through a strong peer environment.
